utterances.speaker: GUTFELD

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yeah.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: They fled Germany and they brought really valuable information to America that helped us create the bomb. So the best tools come from the best and brightest, and they often come from somewhere else.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I like it. Satan 2. We will have a little naming contest for our most scary missiles ever. Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I think that we continue to fail to remember in what bad shape Russia is in from an economic standpoint. They really are on their last leg. Health-wise, the average age of living -- there is another phrase for that.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

utterances.sentences: I like it. utterances.sentences: Jasper 2000.

utterances.sentences: Excellent branding idea. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb19', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb19', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE

And it's mutually assured destruction. As you said, this is not the 80s anymore. These types of threats, we're not totally concerned with. This is kind of like a macho move by Putin because like Dana said, their economy is not doing well, because the oil prices have gone far down. And they are heavily relying on oil and we have really ramped up our natural gas and oil production here.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: And that is really putting a squeeze on their economy. He just got reelected, we just tested a missile, the Trident 2 off of one of our nuclear submarines. This is a response to that. And if we're going to have an arms race, we will win it. They can't afford it. So I am not worried about it. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb20', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb20', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: There you go. Maybe time for Putin to take his shirt off again and ride a horse. Coming to a screen near you. Dana, you have a quick follow-up on that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We're going to win that, too. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Yeah, you know, Ronald Reagan called it the Peace Keeper as opposed to the Satan 2. And people still got the message. But anyway -

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Subtlety.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What concerns me at this moment is we have a shift from HR McMaster to John Bolton at a critical moment in terms of our foreign affairs and what is going on in Syria. We lost a service man today in Syria. if (window && window.foxstrike && Array.isArray(window.foxstrike.cmd)) { window.foxstrike.cmd.push(function(Strike) { Strike.insertAd('desktop', 'lb21', 'desktop-desk-ad-lb21', ''); }); } else { console.error('Error: window.foxstrike not found'); }

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: In fact, two people were killed. One I guess was part of the anti-Assad forces. But we have lots of people there. And this week, guess what, President Trump says, just kind of out of the blue, kind of a shock to everybody in the Pentagon and State Department, we are leaving. We will be out of there soon. utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You were not concerned about that when Obama pulled out of Iraq?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Of course I was.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Let me just tell you something. (Inaudible) weapons of mass destruction. In this case, what you hear for military leaders, is that we think will to fight in Syria, again, as people are saying, you know-- and Trump said it on the stump in Richfield, this week, he said it's time for us to come home. What does that say?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Let's just not cross any redlines.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Exactly. All right. Directly ahead, will Hollywood liberals like Sean Penn take a cue from Roseanne's success. Probably not. Details next.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We all saw the success of Roseanne this week. It featured a conservative voice in primetime entertainment. But will the rest of Hollywood follow suit? Probably not. For example, Sean Penn has written a new book. It trashes the #MeToo movement, it fantasizes about assassinating President Trump. The actor now under fire after his bizarre interview this week. Take a look

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: I wish you move on. Please don't smoke anymore. You know, we want you to be around for a long time. This is bad for you.

utterances.speaker: SEAN PENN, ACTOR
utterances.sentences: This is job security for oncologists. I think it's important to keep up the culture. So I am not ashamed to be here with talented people and with you all in talking about this stuff. If I were a news anchor, I think that rather than reporting, I would pull a fire alarm.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED MALE
utterances.sentences: Yeah, yeah.

utterances.speaker: PENN
utterances.sentences: Every night. I could say that the respect and the aspiration that we modeled is no longer on our country. And in this case, the job includes by any historical parallel, the impeachment of this president.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Wow. So you should know that politics aside, critics on both sides slamming Penn's novel, even calling it -- and here is a quote, stupid. So, Kimberly, what do you make of this? You know, by the way, on Colbert, he said he was on Ambien and then he was smoking. And of course, in New York City, you can't be smoking. But Colbert couldn't stop him. So, do you think he is like out of control, what do you make of this?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: So, yeah, I have known him for a long time. I haven't seen him in a while, you know.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: He is looking good.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Not looking good. I think that he is having obviously some substance abuse problems.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't put it on substance abuse.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: No, no, no. He always had political viewpoints. However, I am seeing a slide here. He is like decompensating, that's not normally how he behaves even under regular circumstances, though. He is not doing well. Let's put it that way.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: My favorite part of the book, he talks about Trump's love of blonde women and says that he believes that yellow lives matter.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's a good line.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: That's a good one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I have come around on Sean. I think he is entertaining. I've watched his interviews on late night usually. And I'm mesmerized by them. He's captivating.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, you're trying to book him, aren't you?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: There is a slot Saturday Night at 8 o'clock. I like how cocky he is. He is old enough now where he doesn't care anymore. I don't respect his opinions when it comes obviously the Me Too movement and assassinating the president. With that said, he is doing his own thing. He's writing, he doesn't have to deal with other people. He says he doesn't like to act in movies because he is not good at collaborating, because he hates everybody else.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That's funny.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's kind of funny. And let him ride. If he's getting criticism from these pencil-neck people at the Washington Post, that's fine. I think that's a badge of honor.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wait, wait, wait. The Guardian was also --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: He's been unbearable. But now, I think -- I'm warming up to him.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I don't want you to damage your brain. Kimberly says you are saying these things just to book him.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: My brain is fine.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Dana, one of the things he says is he wants to have a duel with the President in this book. The book is called "Bob Honey Who Just Do Stuff".

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: It would be really fun if Ronny Jackson, the president's personal doctor, now nominated to be Veterans Affairs secretary, could give a physical to Sean Penn and compare it to President Trump's results and see what we would find. I think think smoking on air. Hollywood likes to lecture America on all sorts of things, from eating habits and all sorts of stuff. And then that's allowed? That, I think, is really bad form.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Bad form. Well, let's go to good form -- Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. OK. So I want to focus completely on the book. Because tomorrow night on my show, I'm having a celebrity read excerpts from the book. The book is horribly written, because he relies completely on a thesaurus. And the whole point is, you can't let --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I hate that.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You can't -- if you're going to use a thesaurus, people should not be able to know that you're using a thesaurus. That's the sign of a hack. And it reminds me of me in high school when you write a short story to impress a girl, and you look up all these words. But it's a beginner's mistake.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's not how I impressed girls.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: I don't even know.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I didn't write them a short story.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Who has --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Maybe that's the different between and you me.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It really is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: But his arrogance and he's trying to go hard. It's exactly the same error a novice political thinker who comes into politics late in life and you come into writing late. The arrogance that you possess is inversely proportional to the wisdom, and the knowledge and the skill. So he just thinks he's really good at things he knows nothing about. In this case, it's writing and also politics.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know who's a good writer and actor that became a novelist is Steve Martin.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes, yes. He was a great -- he could write jokes. He was a great writer when he was a comedian.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I just saw Steve Martin's show on Broadway, that he wrote anyway. Don't you go anywhere. Because when we come back, our good friend, Geraldo Rivera, he joins us to preview his fascinating new book.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: We all remember Geraldo Rivera's reports from war zones around the world, including the mountains of Afghanistan, on the hunt for Osama bin Laden and many more. After nearly 50 years in the news business, our friend and colleague opens up about his career and life in his new memoir, "The Geraldo Show." It hits stores on Tuesday. But he hits us right now. Here he is with us.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So congratulations.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I appreciate that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: This is an amazing, wonderful accomplishment. A book that you can write after a really amazing career.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You know, a half century is one of my greatest achievements. Just being enduring, just being able to go through so many changes in popular culture and taste. You know, being made fun of five different decades on "Saturday Night Live."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That is a really cute one (ph).

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Really.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Jesse is working on that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: You'll get there. You'll get there. Hang in there.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I don't know if that's what I want.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Keep stumbling.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Keep stumbling? OK, Geraldo. You know what? I wasn't going to ask you this question. Now I am.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: When I was a producer back in the day, I remember being in the little edit rooms. And we used to watch footage of you dodging bullets in the war zones, and you were screaming and the bullets were whizzing by. Was there ever one moment where you thought to yourself, "I'm about to die"?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: In Libya. A great question. In Libya in 2011 when Gaddafi was on the lam. And the remnants of his army were being sued by the Islamists, of course, who later became allied by the extremists. I got caught between the two very disorganized, very heavily-armed groups. And so the bullets, literally from both sides flying over our heads. You could hear me muttering profanities.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think that was the video I was watching.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: "F-word, f-word." And it was so vivid that Jon Stewart actually mocked it in his -- in his Comedy Central program. He made Geraldo of Arabia. He took my tape and he superimposed it on the iconic scenes from the great movie with Peter O'Toole. And he interspliced it with our actual war footage. He did it to make fun of me. But I took it as homage. Almost used his title, "Geraldo of Arabia," as my title.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: A badge of honor, when you're mocked by "The Daily Show."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Greg, any thoughts or questions?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I do, actually. My favorite Geraldo moment -- and you are actually part of pop culture, whether you like it or not. My favorite moment was not in the war era. It was on your show when you had G.G. Allin on.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And I think you had -- I don't remember if it was he same show with Jello Biafra. But the G.G. Allin show remains, like, burned into my brain. Could you explain what that show -- do you remember that show?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Wasn't that the party punks of New York?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: These were he -- he was in a band called the Murder Junkies.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: They just hated and wanted everybody to die.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: How appropriate that only Greg Gutfeld would get that obscure moment in with the fringiest of fringe groups. You know, G.G. did not make the book.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't remember G.G.?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Of course. I remember, I remember. It's not like my Mom does --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Geraldo Show, 2.0.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Did you ever regret a story that you did?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Ah, that's an excellent, excellent question. When I -- I regret -- let me tell you what I regret. I regret in 2002 backing down from backing the Palestinians in their conflict with Israel, the second Intifada. Because I saw with my own eyes how -- and I know this is going to resonate very poorly with the people watching right now. But still, I have to tell you how I feel. I saw firsthand how those people were, and now you just had 14, 15 people killed in Gaza. Palestinians killed by the idea forces. I saw what an awful life they live under constant occupation and oppression. And people keep saying, they are terrorists. Or they're this or they're that. They are an occupied people. And I regret chickening out after 2002 and not staying on that story and adding my voice, as a Jew, adding my voice to those counselling a two-state solution. It's so easy to put them out of sight, out of mind and let them rot and be killed and keep this thing festering. And I think a lot of our current problems stem from, it's our origin sin, Palestine and Israel. I want a two-state solution. I want President Trump to reenergize our --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You might see one. You might see one.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I hope so.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Juan?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: So I have a two-part thing, Geraldo. One is I remember you as a young reporter who went into the hospitals here in New York City. And maybe the audience doesn't know that part of you. Why don't you just explain that part of your history?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: That is my greatest achievement, Juan. There's no doubt about it. The Willowbrook State School in New York City. Staten Island, one of the boroughs, five boroughs of New York. It was the nation's largest and one of the world's worst institutions for the population we used to describe as mentally retarded and now called developmentally disabled. And to expose the institution and to advocate and champion a different way for those people to be treated so they have a normal life as possible. Their human potential can be fulfilled and have those institutions closed as a result of the pressure from our investigations. That's my signature achievement. I -- it was my greatest moment. And the rest of my life since then has been a follow-up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Can I just -- do you have any worries about what happened after that? Where a lot of the unstable people are when you walk around New York City, and see all the homeless?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Just very briefly. The mentally -- when we called them the mentally retarded, it was easier to distinguish.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Developmental disabilities, people like Down's syndrome or autistic. You know, reduced mental capacity. The mentally ill, the schizophrenic and the bipolar. That's a different population. And the -- and what happened with the -- that population, I think, was an unfortunate-- maybe a side effect to my exposes. But people confused the two populations.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: They're two different conditions totally. The homelessness you see are not the developmentally disabled. Those are people who are schizophrenic.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I want to say before we go on that that was a tremendous journalistic achievement. I don't think people understand. Awesome.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Because we're out of time. I'm Puerto Rican. I am proud of you. I was so excited to come here to work at FOX News. I've always admired your work and your fearlessness, your journalistic capabilities. And my brother is watching, too. We stayed up all night to watch you, the vault. Very proud of you with bin Laden. The reporter that you did there was also really special.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Being on the air the night bin Laden was killed, or the announcement came, was the greatest night of my career. To be able to bring that news, after what happened here in 9-11, after obsessively pursuing the terrorist mastermind for 10 years. To then be on the air when we -- I could break the news that Rob O'Neill and his mates in SEAL Team 6 had killed the S.O.B, I loved that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: So much is in the timing.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: I just want to say quickly about Al Capone's vault, it's an iconic reference. That's true. You know, like Stormy Daniels was Al Capone's vault, in my mind. A lot of hype, delivered nothing.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: All right. Geraldo, congratulations --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.sentences: Thank you.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: -- on the book. Up next, we're answering your questions from our social media pages on this very fantastic "Fan Mail Friday." Stay right there.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Fan Mail Friday," your questions answered. First question, we don't have much time. Kimberly, "What" -- this is from 6Hill. "What is the weirdest thing you've ever seen in someone else's home?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh! Do we have the time? Yes, so in someone else's home? Hmmm. Actually, it was probably in my apartment. When I first bought it, and I went in to go see it.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: And it had 200 dead animals hanging all over the wall.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: My goodness.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Gigantic -- there was a taxidermy when -- it was a really crazy night at the museum.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Taxidermy sounds so nice, but sometimes it's not.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Everyone, like, wrote about me, "Guilfoyle, that's horrifying." Taxidermy. Dead animals. Haters are going to hate.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I think it's art.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know, where you see, like, people who have pictures of themselves.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Like Greg?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Like Greg --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: He has all these paintings of themselves.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I'm talking about, like, an oil painting done of themselves. I think that's pretty weird.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh my gosh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Jesse.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: My sister's husband. I think their parents made them, like, pose for an oil painting like this when they were about, like, 9 or 11. And they're wearing all white and they're just like this.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: This will be good for Easter Sunday.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It was completely humiliating. So I was -- I loved walking through the house and making fun of them.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I can't really remember. I do remember going to one of the coolest houses I've ever been in. There was a fund-raiser at a private home in Ohio. And the staff, like, we just had to wait in the basement. So the basement had every possible thing you could imagine. There was a game room. Like a movie theater. They had a cellar for, like, all the wine. I didn't drink any wine. But that's all I can think of.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I'm going to tell a good story. I never tell good stories.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: When I was in my early 20s, I had -- I flew to L.A. to meet with a film producer. You know the story?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes, yes.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: To pitch a screen play. And I was extremely nervous. Like stomach nervous, if you know what I mean.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: We know, we know.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: And I rang the doorbell. I opened -- it was a mansion in Bel- Air. And I walked in -- or it was Brentwood. And I looked to my left, and there was a butler holding a tray. And I look, and I look away and I sit down and I sit in front of the butler. And I go, "Don't think of the butler." The producer came down. He just won Best Picture. I won't say for what. Came down and we started -- we started to talk. And I was so nervous, because you can't concentrate when you have somebody behind you all the time just standing there. And he could tell, but when I was trying to pitch this thing, that I wasn't making any sense. And he felt really bad. So he went and got me a beer. I sat there, and I go, you know, "I have to talk to this guy." Because I kept thinking, "This guy probably came to Hollywood for a big break, and he's a waiter."

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: A butler.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: He's a butler. And I'm some jerk from, you know, D.C. who flew in to this, and I'm a nobody. I said, "Maybe I should just say hello to him." And I turned around, and it was a wooden -- it was a wooden butler with an apple head.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: What a psycho you are.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It wasn't a real butler?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: It wasn't a real butler.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Could you even see?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Great question to you, Dana. From Stella T.: "Do you collect anything?"

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: That was a terrible story!

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I do not -- no, I do not collect anything.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You don't collect anything?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'm not sentimental in any way.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Not even hobbies? Now, Jesse, do you collect anything?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: A bad habit.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Is that her name?

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh my God!

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Anyway, Juan.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Get a move on.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: What I have on my desk, I have baseballs --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Baseballs.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: And signed by various people, you know, like Barack Obama signed a baseball for me. Condi Rice signed a baseball for me. Recently, I got one from Dusty Baker. Bryce Harper signed a baseball.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: I'll sign one for you. Just let me know.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You know what I have? I have --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I'll throw it at you.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: I have a baseball.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Have your signature all over it.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: We made the road trip. Remember, we made the road trip during the 2016 campaign?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You kept something from that?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Everybody signed a baseball that we got --

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, I remember that.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: -- at PNC Stadium in Pittsburgh.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Excellent. Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Yes. Not going to say that I collect marriages. I'm going to say challenge coins, because I actually do. I collect challenge coins, and I have some nice ones.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That's a good answer.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: State of the Union.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Better answer than me.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: You know what I collect a lot of? I collect those little plastic packages that have two kinds of mustard in it and a fork and a little -- a little tissue from the Chinese restaurant.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Chinese restaurant.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I've got a lot of those.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That will a nice thing to pass on to your nieces and nephews.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Yes, I think they'll be very happy.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Can you imagine?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: That will be in my will.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: His apartment at his death, the hoarding.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Hoarding is a skill. All right. "One More Thing," next.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: It's time for "One More Thing" -- Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You've been missing it. Here -- it's time for this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Corny joke.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Dana's Corny Joke of the Day.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: OK, I've got -- we're going to go real fast. What music does the Easter bunny like?

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Hip-hop.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Very good.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Whoa! Juan.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Very good. What kind of jewelry does the Easter bunny wear?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Faberge eggs.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: That was a good guess. Fourteen-carrot gold. Come on! OK, joke three. What do you call a mischievous egg?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Bad egg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: A practical yolker. Very good. And the last one, where does the Easter bunny eat breakfast? Where does the Easter bunny --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: IHOP.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Yes!

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Wow.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Wow, congratulations.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Very corny and very funny. Go ahead, Kimberly.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Very awesome. OK, baby. This is "Candy Court." No graphic and no support. On Easter, thank you. According to the National Retail Federation, Easter spending is expected to total $18.2 billion this year, the second highest level ever on record. We can thank President Trump for making Easter profitable again. The Easter bunny and candy tops the list of planned purchases to help celebrate, followed by food, gifts, clothing and greeting cards. We've got some Peeps here -- I did my research -- courtesy of the candy man who knows everything. He's my favorite, the big distributor of candy in the country. Greg, get out of my shot. There you go.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Candy to celebrate. So there you go.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Excellent. OK. "Watters World" this weekend, we did a little Easter quiz. Here's a sneak peek.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Oh, dear.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What does Good Friday mean, in your opinion?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Nothing.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why not?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I don't shop.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: You don't shop?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: No.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: I think you mean Black Friday.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Whatever.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: What happened on Good Friday?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Jesus was hung on the cross.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Why was Jesus crucified?

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: For rocking the boat.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: That's one way to put it.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK, so this week, the quiz. And the Mark Levin, the Great One. And the clown who's running for Congress.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Which one?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: The Democrat. Who else? Greg.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: All right. Saturday, tomorrow, 10 p.m., we've got Candace Owens. Great, great, great person. Rob Long, OK guy. Tyrus and Kat Timpf, 10 p.m. And we've got a special celebrity reading Sean Penn's book. Now it's time for, quickly --

utterances.speaker: GRAPHIC
utterances.sentences: Greg's Don't You Just Hate That?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: "Greg's Don't You Just Hate That?" All right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Don't you just hate it when you're trying to get to work but some cat gets into your car that sits on your hood and you can't go anywhere. And it's not really a cat, it's a cheetah. You're on safari. And if you move the cat might actually eat your entire face off? So you just have to sit and wait quietly until the -- well, that cat in the back seat -- no, he's not going anywhere. He's going to stay.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: You know what curiosity did.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Well, it's not going to kill this guy. Look at him. He's just happy as a clam.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: Anything else, Greg?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: I have another one.

utterances.speaker: UNIDENTIFIED FEMALE
utterances.sentences: I bet you've got --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.sentences: Podcast. Next week.

utterances.speaker: GUILFOYLE
utterances.sentences: Oh, my gosh.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: OK. Juan.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: Here we go. This is every boy's dream. Somebody on the big team gets hurt. The coach points to the stands and says, "You're in, kid." That's what happened Thursday night in Chicago. The Blackhawks hockey team saw both their goalies go down. The coach had no choice but to put in 32- year-old accountant Scott Foster. He's part of a group of recreational players available in case of emergencies. But he never thought he'd actually get to play in an NHL game. And boy, did he play well. He stopped all 7 shots fired at him over the final 14 minutes of the Blackhawks' victory. Way to go, Scott Foster.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Cool.

utterances.speaker: WILLIAMS
utterances.sentences: You made dreams come true for us all.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: Maybe being a goalie is not that hard. I mean, just -- the big pads on. I mean, he's an accountant and he stopped seven shots.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.sentences: Somebody please challenge Jesse. Please, please.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.sentences: All right. That's it for us tonight. We'll see you back here on Monday. Happy Easter and Passover. "Special Report" is up next -- Shannon.
